attributes.action: Stop the removal of NHS bursaries for student radiographers and nurses
attributes.background: An NHS bursary is currently available for students studying Radiography and Nursing. This is essential financial support as these courses involve both clinical and academic components. The Government is proposing to remove these bursaries and replace them with student loans.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS bursary supports the student to undertake clinical placements as part of their training. These can be up to 16 weeks in duration and in rural areas the distance between the campus and hospital is uncommutable, requiring the student to pay rent on their main accommodation plus rent, living and travel expenses in their clinical setting. This is financially disadvantageous to students in rural areas like Cumbria, Devon and Northumberland and will have a negative impact on the profession.

attributes.action: Ban plastic "6 pack rings" and use biodegradable / edible alternatives
attributes.background: Over 100,000 marine animals and 1m sea birds die each year after digesting or getting stuck in plastic "6 pack rings".  I would like government to force manufacturers to use environmentally friendly alternatives / edible (for aquatic life) options.
attributes.additional_details: "6 Pack Ring" refers to the plastic rings used to keep 6 tins or cans of drink together.  As an Island nation we should take the lead to protect our shores and the animals that inhabit them.  A company in the US has developed an edible (to the aquatic life) alternative made using grains from the brewing process.  The rings we use now are photodegradable but can take up to 90 days to break.  Plenty of time to kill a seal, bird, turtle or other marine life that thinks it's something to eat.

attributes.action: Make egg manufacturers legally obliged to display a method of male chick culling
attributes.background:
UK legislation should provide an enforceable law that every egg pack produced in an egg factory must have a clearly visible and well readable statement what killing methods of male chicks are used in the given egg factory, for example:

"Method of male chick culling: Suffocation"
attributes.additional_details:
Chick culling is a common method of a male chick disposal as males don't lay eggs and are therefore unnecessary waste generating no financial or other profit for the egg industry.

It is morally unacceptable that egg manufacturers can accompany their products with images of happy hens whilst not revealing the information about this inhumane cruelty happening on a huge scale in their factory premises on a daily basis. That is effectively deceiving the consumers by a false advertisement.

attributes.action: To abolish the tv licence fee completely
attributes.background: I am trying to get the outdated tv licence fee abolished and let it get private donations like sky or virgin

attributes.action: Pass the same sentences for offences against animals as offences against humans
attributes.background: Every day you hear of terrible offences against animals, including cruelty, torture and murder. I propose the same sentencing for perpetrators of these crimes as there would be if they had committed the same offence against a human. The current sentences passed are too light.

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: Make 30th july awareness day for gastroschisis.
attributes.background: Gastroschisis affects 1-3000 births. After birth surgery is needed. Gastroschisis is a hole in the abdominal wall allowing the intestines(some other organs) to form on the outside off the body.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter is 1 off these babies affected. She has long term complications and has been on medication since birth. Every case is different hospitals stays can be anything from 2 weeks-1year+ some dont make it. Alot of health professionals i have seen dont know about this condition themselves this is how unknown gastroschisis is.

attributes.action: Stop the spending of £1.9million taxpayers money on a pointless wall in Calais.
attributes.background: The UK government invested over £20million of tax payers money reinforcing UK border security at the port of Calais in 2014. Stop them investing a further £1.9million on a pointless wall.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government and Calais mayor want to build a 4m high border wall around the ferry port at Calais to the tune of £1.9million of UK tax money. This would drastically affect the safety of refugees trying to cross into the UK who would have to face further devastatingly dangerous situations. The wall would also present the first border wall to be erected in Europe since the Berlin wall.

Please sign this petition if you agree we should be seeking better solutions than building pointless walls.

attributes.action: Stop the closure of the Mental Health Welland Centre in Market Harborough.
attributes.background: This centre is my sole source of free support where I, like so many others, have crucial appointments with a psychiatrist. The closure of this centre means appointments would be held in Wigton. But for people who cannot drive and have anxiety when using public transport this will made be difficult.
attributes.additional_details: The wider issue here is the governments neglect of the mental health services in the United Kingdom. I realise there are probably many cases in towns, villages or cities where these centres are being closed down and I would encourage those effected by these changed to petition against them too.

attributes.action: Grant Patrick Aganozor a VISA to donate his bone marrow to his brother
attributes.background: Patrick Aganozor is a 50% match for his brother's cell transplant who is in urgent need of bone marrow donation in order to  save him from leukaemia. Patrick - who lives in Nigeria- was a refused a visa into the Uk in April by the British High Commission. Time is running out to save Isaac...
attributes.additional_details: In August 2015 Isaac Aganozor was diagnosed with leukaemia. Isaac (44) continued to work until December 2015 when his condition deteriorated and he was no longer able to work. Isaac's hopes of fighting the disease were boosted when his brother tested as a  50% match for his brother's treatment. The British High Commissioner in Lagos, however, refused his VISA on the grounds that he was not convinced that Patrick will 'leave the Uk at the end of your stay'.If we are to save Isaac we must act now.

attributes.action: Stop bombing Syria!
attributes.background: At the moment the UK are bombing Syria killing a huge amount of innocent people. There are more efficient methods. Let's help the people of Syria and try and stop these bombings! Please take a few minutes to sign.

attributes.action: Investigate an incinerator at Rivenhall outputting 500,000 tonnes of CO2
attributes.background: In 2010 the secretary of state approved an IWMF at Rivenhall with bio mass generator and an incinerators for solid recovered fuels. This was approved for planning without an EA permit on the 26th Feb 2016 via a S73 variation that reduces Bio Mass by 70% whilst increasing Incinerated waste by 60%
attributes.additional_details: The new plant now produces only 28Mw power is being built at risk (no EA permit) and is relying on the change process. The changes in the plant capacities move it DOWN the wast hierarchy not up. The new plant will disperse poisonous gasses over Essex prime farm land and historic housing. In addition the plant will produce some 500,000 tones of CO2 that is totally contrary to the current thinking and is not sustainable. The planners have allowed this to progress at risk.

attributes.action: Bring back legal aid for family law. And give fathers 50/50 rights
attributes.background: it's diabolical that legal aid has been removed from family law. Dads all over the country are not getting a fair hearing and through lack of knowledge and unfair rules that favor the mother we are loosing are kids. the law needs to be changed to stop mothers alienating fathers from their own blood
attributes.additional_details: My son saw a picture that was on my Facebook page and it stated dads are just as important as mums.  I was shocked at my 7 year old sons response he looked at it laughed and said with no hesitation no they are not and walked away. I was so upset at this because one day my boys will be dads too. And they will start life having a very  low estimate of themselves as fathers.  And I think it's time for dads to make a stand for our children...

attributes.action: Legally Recognise Nonbinary Gender Identities
attributes.background: Passports and drivers licenses have no options for those who identify outside of the gender binary, they are being misrepresented on legal documentation due to the lack of gender options. Some countries offer alternative choices such as 'X'; the UK should be taking the same steps towards equality.

attributes.action: Exclude the Armed Forces core meal provision from the 20% VAT rate
attributes.background:
While the last review left the Daily Food Charge set at £4.79, from October the 1st the cost of a core meal at a Pay As You Dine facility will increase to £5.75 to account for VAT at the 20% rate.

No VAT should be paid on core meal provisions or proper cooking facilities should be provided.
attributes.additional_details:
The increase is due to PAYD facilities having to charge VAT on the DFC, which in turn reduces the amount of money left to actually provide the meal.

With little cooking facilities available to service personnel living in military accommodation, it is unfair to ask such personnel to pay the 20% VAT rate when they have little or no other options for cooking their own meal(s).

Core meal provisions are not a luxury and should not be charged as such.

attributes.action: For the term 'Accountant' to be legally defined and protected.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to have the term ‘accountant’ legally defined and protected.
attributes.additional_details: This is due to us being increasingly concerned by the poor advice businesses and individuals are being given by individuals claiming to be qualified accountants, when in fact they have had little or no professional training and lack the qualifications to deal with complex financial issues.

attributes.action: Change or ease the rules surrounding 'gardens' on baby graves.
attributes.background: 8 weeks after burying my little boy, who was born asleep in June of this year, we recieved a "rule book" stating what we can and cannot do with his resting place that a paid for. Such rules included not being able to lay stones and not coming away from the headstone by more then 12" etc.
attributes.additional_details:
I know that the rules in baby gardens and what is 'allowed' differs nationally. After being asked recently to remove ALL items from my little boy's grave, I'm petitioning to get the rules at certain cemeteries eased or changed, to allow bereaved parents to decorate their child's resting place as they see fit, providing it remains maintained by the grave 'owner'. 

Buried babies may only be a plot number to some, but they are our children and deserve their own little gardens. 

Thank you.

attributes.action: Allow unaccompanied refugee minors in Calais be fostered or adopted in the UK.
attributes.background: "We the undersigned believe the Government needs to reconsider it's policy on the receiving of child migrants from Calais. There are many people waiting g to adopt or foster right now who could look after these children.
attributes.additional_details: Having had a fostering placement open for 4 months and knowing others in a similar situation these children can be accommodated in loving homes. There are 1500 people waiting to adopt from a pool of 500 children in the UK, numerous foster placements staying empty due to the need to place sibling groups together, when many carers can only take one child. There is space for these children and a change is needed now to prevent a humanitarian disaster on our doorstep.

attributes.action: Make legislation for toilet facilities to be provided for bus drivers on routes.
attributes.background: We want the UK Government to make legislation which will require bus operators and local authorities to provide adequate toilet facilities for bus drivers along their routes.

attributes.action: Scrap land factor maintenance arrangements by companies on housing estates.
attributes.background: New estates are burdened with extra maintenance charges from private companies. The industry is unregulated, uncontrolled and monopolised in such a manner that unfairly disadvantages residents
attributes.additional_details:
There are hundreds of new build estates across the UK that are burdened with extra charges to resident for the maintenance of the open shared spaces on their estates. The residents have no choice in which company carries out the work. The charges are over inflated, the quality of work is substandard and companies bully residents into continued payments with threats of legal action. 
There seems to be no clear way of complaint, and no independent way of arbitration or enforcement of standards.

attributes.action: Parliament to save the UK from breaking up by rejecting the EU referendum vote
attributes.background: The result was too close for such a major constitutional change and the consequences are far greater than people imagined.  The generation it will most affect were not all represented. 16 - 18 year olds voted in the Scottish referendum but why not in the EU referendum?

attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative to adding a runway to Heathrow or Gatwick.
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and only requires the upgrading of rail and road links which would greatly benefit East Anglia and would be easier and cheaper than proceeding with Heathrow or Gatwick

attributes.action: Stop treating Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) as chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)
attributes.background: The NHS offers treatment for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) and tells us that CFS is "also known as" Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) in order to justify treating ME the same as CFS. It is unethical to treat one condition as another; it makes patients more ill and is a waste of time and money.
attributes.additional_details: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis means "muscle pain + inflammation of the brain and spinal cord", in other words it is a neurological illness. It is accepted as such by the World Health Organization (WHO). The term CFS was coined in the USA and seized upon by psychiatrists in the UK, and today the psychiatric view of ME (that ME does not exist but is really a "fatigue syndrome") now dictates the Department of Health, Nice, and NHS policy. While this policy remains in place, ME patients are untreated.

attributes.action: More rights for victims and family of victims of crime
attributes.background: Since our son James was killed in a hit and run, little if any consideration has been given to his rights or that of his family. Conversely, the rights of those responsible for James' death have been a constant course of consideration, allowing them to exercise those rights on more than 12 occasions
attributes.additional_details: The right to live and enjoy life was taken from James at 25 by the callous actions of Majid Malik and Kiaz Mahmood as they raced their cars at 90mph in a 40mph zone. Since that day the judicial system has continually provided opportunities for these serial criminals to exercise their rights, protecting them from facing the consequences of their actions. We have had no such rights, James' rights are ignored in favour of the criminals. Time for a change, it's the rights of victims that matter.

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.

attributes.action: A5 Near Chirk traffic calming between Halton Roundabout & Gledrid Roundabout.
attributes.background:
In light of numerous collisions, causalities and fatalities on the A5 near Chirk between Halton Roundabout and Gledrid Roundabout.

We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement an average speed camera system and overtaking restrictions to prevent further collisions.

attributes.action: Provide protection for closed railway track-beds to aid rural regeneration.
attributes.background: In the mid -1960's Dr Beeching was employed to find ways of making the railways more profitable and his report resulted in the closure of a large part of our railway network. The report failed to take into account the growth in population and the necessity for rural transport.
attributes.additional_details: The railways were mainly built under Act of Parliament. After closure Local Authorities have sold off railway land for development. Usage for footpaths and cycleways is fine. Building houses and industrial estates prevent regeneration of these railways. Scotrail have reopened part of the old Waverley route. Groups would like to reopen lines such as the Somerset, Dorset, Deeside line, Lynton & Barnstable and Matlock, Bakewell & Buxton and Cliffe Hill Mineral Railway. Local authorites should be required to aid projects and reject planning for developments.

attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the Yulin Dog Eating Festival in 2016
attributes.background: Thousands of dogs are tortured to death during the annual Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, beaten to death, burned with blowtorches and dismembered while still alive. Many dogs are stolen family pets - they still have their collars on. Yulin began in 2009, it is not 'tradition.'
attributes.additional_details: Officials have said Yulin does not exist, or that it is 'on the decline,' but the horrific pictures and press reports from 2014 and 2015 say otherwise (#stopyulin). Please sign this petition to ask the UK government to reach out to the Chinese government this year to intervene and stop this barbaric event in 2016. Sign this petition if you believe it is a matter of urgency that the UK government take this action in 2016.

attributes.action: Osseointegration for NHS patients
attributes.background: Osseointegration is for a metal implant anchored in to the bone to all prosthetic limbs to be surgically attached. This will vastly improve people's lives. Current the U.K. Government will not fund this. This has to change
attributes.additional_details: Dr kang at the royal free hospital advised me the only way the operations would go ahead is by people pressuring government to allow funding for these operations. Join me in making this a reality and improving so many people's lives

attributes.action: Allow motorcyclists aged 19+ to ride a 250cc on a CBT license
attributes.background: You are allowed to ride bikes of up to 55hp when you are 19 on a full bike license and you are allowed to do this with no previous experience. I don't see why riders with 2 years experience shouldn't be able to get a bit of extra power as having a small amount of power can be dangerous at times.

attributes.action: Make causing death by careless driving through speeding a prison sentence
attributes.background: Causing death by speeding can still fall into careless and I think it needs to be a prison sentence. Taking someone's life due to speeding is dangerous and needs to be punished. Losing your licence or paying a fine is not enough.

attributes.action: Demand a second Scottish referendum if the UK votes to leave the EU
attributes.background: If the majority of Scottish voters vote to remain part of the EU but the UK as a whole votes to leave on 23rd June 2016, Scotland, as a europhile country, should have another referendum on independence.

attributes.action: Pause HMRC's office closures until the taxation impact of Brexit is understood
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU will have a major impact on the work done by HMRC; particularly VAT, Customs and International Trade. 
We call on HMRC to suspend its plans to close offices and cut jobs, until Parliament agrees the functions HMRC will need to undertake following the decision to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) plans to close 90% of its offices; and cut 9,000 more jobs by 2021
HMRC refuse to acknowledge the organisational impact of leaving the EU, saying it doesn’t change their closure plans. This threatens HMRC's future ability to collect the taxes which provide for the funding for essential services including defence, education, healthcare, policing and welfare
HMRC has already closed its office in Newry, which stands on what will be the UK's only land border with the EU

attributes.action: One electronic recording system to safeguard all children and young people
attributes.background: Safeguarding is the responsibility of all agencies, yet we don't all have access to the same system for recording.  We all hold pieces to the puzzle but don't have access to the 'big picture'.  We can only safeguard our young people, if professionals work together to put the pieces together.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation 'Keeping Children Safer in Education' specifies the legal duty for anyone working in Education.  We should have one clear piece of legislation that involves all agencies and states 'What we should do, how we should all work together to achieve it and how we record it.' Too many young people are slipping the net, through agencies not sharing and recording information on the same system.   Lessons learnt from serious case reviews, repeatedly comment on lack of shared communication.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for glucose levels of newborns to be checked before discharge
attributes.background: The test is a simple heel prick.  It can help to indicate if your baby is  converting its milk feed into the required source of glucose. If the level is too low the body/brain cannot function sufficiently,  the baby may have seizures and fall into a coma. Stop it happening to someone else's baby.
attributes.additional_details: My daughters levels were not checked.  We were discharged and she subsequently fell into a coma and had seizures.  This has left her with damage to her brain and epilepsy. A simple test prior to leaving hospital would have shown low blood sugars and immediate attention could have prevented the ensuing damage.  I wish to prevent this happening to anyone else.

attributes.action: Teens and young adults with Type 1 Diabetes have a right to PIP.
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes is a life long, life threatening condition. Current government legislation does consider it to be a disability for children aged 16 and above.  PIP would give them the financial help they need to fund the additional things they need to become independent.
attributes.additional_details: It is a proven fact that without the help and support of parents/health professionals and peers.  Adolescents would struggle to cope with the day to day care of dealing with the challenges of Type 1 diabetes.  They are more likely to be hospitalised and suffer damage to their bodies that come with poor management.  The policies of this current government, denies them the support they need during these difficult years. PIP awards would help these young people cope with the financial strain of daily living, and give recognition that Type 1 diabetes is a disability.

attributes.action: Move Parliament to 6 regional cities while the House of Parliament is repaired.
attributes.background:
The plan for MPs and Lords to vacate the Palace of Westminster during repairs and move to offices nearby is flawed.

MPs should grasp the opportunity to take Parliament to the People.

We call for the UK Parliament to relocate to a different regional city each year of the 6 year refurbishment.

attributes.action: Stop plans to allow more secondary schools to select children by ability.
attributes.background: Selection harms children, divides communities and lowers overall attainment. The 11+ exam is inherently unfair - evidence shows that it selects on the basis of prior opportunity and social background. Poorer children, including high ability poor children, lose out most.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who fail the 11+ suffer a severe blow to their self-esteem and motivation at a critical time in their development. 
Figures suggest that these children (70-80% of the total) go on to do worse at secondary modern than they would have at a comprehensive. 
Selective areas have the largest achievement gaps in the country. 
In fully selective Bucks, the 11+ pass rate for FSM children was 4% in 2014, compared to 20% for state pupils and 53% for private school pupils.

attributes.action: Amnesty for commonwealth illegal skilled immigrants.
attributes.background: In the time of labour government a huge numbers of students came from commonwealth countries but for the immigration cuts like psw tier 1, most of them left United Kingdom. A very few number of them are still surviving in uk in a miserable life, who can do work for the nation for batter future.
attributes.additional_details: The former honorable immigration minister and present prime minister knows everything clearly how they made the condition. So, please take an argent action.

attributes.action: Full review of sentencing guidelines for convicted child sex offenders
attributes.background:
The legal system would appear to be too lenient on paedophiles. 
Many repeat offenders with dozens of convictions only get suspended prison sentences.  
This is not only no deterrent but also leaves them free to re-offend. 
I would like this reviewed as it is outdated.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware of a paedophile who was convicted of grooming a 13 year old girl online who he planned to have sex with.
This was his 27th offence and he received an 8 month prison sentence, suspended for 2 years.  I do not feel this is justice for his victim(s).
This is just one of a catalogue of child sex offenders who are getting off too lightly and repeatedly putting vulnerable children in danger.

attributes.action: Introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths
attributes.background: Every winter, thousands of people die in the UK due to the cold.  In 2014/2015 the number of excess winter deaths rose to 43,900 according to the Office of National Statistics.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is a clear link between excess winter deaths and the cold, the UK suffers from higher levels of excess winter deaths than a number of traditionally colder countries including Scandinavian countries such as Sweden and Finland.

Currently, the government does not have a national plan to reduce the number of excess winter deaths. 

This petition is calling on the government to take action and introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths.

attributes.action: Repeal the Housing & Planning Act passed in May 2016.
attributes.background: In times of increasing job insecurity & homelessness, instead of building much-needed council & social housing to create homes and jobs, this Act forces the sale of council homes, prohibits the building of new council homes, allows councils to sell off council estates and ends security of tenure.
attributes.additional_details:
It also forces existing council tenants earning above a certain amount to pay rent at inflated, unregulated market prices and extends the right to buy to Housing Association tenants, thereby greatly reducing the country's stock of homes to let at a reasonable rent.
This Act will exacerbate the hardships suffered by the most vulnerable who will be forced into costly and unstable private rented accommodation and will place many more in a vulnerable, insecure situation for the first time.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on key Brexit deals BEFORE giving Article 50 notice
attributes.background: There is no democracy without informed consent. Voters did not know before 23 June the terms on which we would leave the EU, the global trade deals which would be done or our immigration policy following Brexit. These must be agreed and voted on BEFORE we give irrevocable Art 50 notice to leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50 is a one way street.  Once it gives one, that state must leave the EU after 2 years (or more if the remaining 27 agree).  We do not need to give notice until we KNOW that the terms we would have (both with the EU and the rest of the world) would be better outside than inside the EU.

We should promptly negotiate with the EU and others and put these deals to the electorate.  Only if the electorate votes in favour should we leave.  A statute should stop notice being given otherwise.

attributes.action: Stop Britain from being subjected to all new EU regulations and treaty changes.
attributes.background: The British people democratically decided to leave the EU.  The government could have revoked the European Communities Act 1972 and left straight away.  However it has decided to use the much slower European Union Article 50 route.  It now makes no sense at all to be bound by any new EU legislation.
attributes.additional_details: At this point in time the EU Commission could rush through all manner of legislation to frustrate Britain's amicable exit from Europe.  They could at a stroke of a pen extend the time covered by Article 50 from two years to five or more.  They could bring in treaty change legislation to literally milk our country for all the money they can get before we leave.  This petition is designed to encourage our government politicians to seriously consider this eventuality and prevent it from happening.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of funding allocated to our police force
attributes.background: West Yorkshire Police are stretched to capacity, more funding urgently needs to be allocated to enable the force to be more effective, match capacity to demand. Currently demand outweighs capacity, officers are under huge pressure facing assaults and huge workloads. More frontline police are needed.

attributes.action: Play an active role in achieving a peaceful resolution to the Kashmir dispute.
attributes.background: The Kashmir dispute has not been resolved for over 7 decades. In recent days, we have seen further Indian atrocities committed against the people of Kashmir leaving many dead. The UK government must play its role in pressuring the Indian government to halt its hostilities and to reach a resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
We petition the UK government to:

1) Pressurise the Indian government to halt its hostilities in Indian occupied Kashmir, against the people of Kashmir.

2) Play an active diplomatic role to reach a peaceful settlement of the Kashmir dispute.

3) Ensure, through diplomacy, that the UN Resolutions regarding a free and fair referendum in Kashmir are enforced. Thus, the people of Kashmir may exercise self-determination once and for all without the influence of any State in/out of the region.

attributes.action: Don't invest in the Hinkley reactor. Subsidise green energy and storage instead
attributes.background:
Hinkley is predicted to cost £18bn to build, and it will cost consumers upwards of £30bn to run.
It will displace billions of investment that could otherwise be spent on green energy. 

Energy demands and generation methods change every year, we should not make such a costly long term commitment
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/05/scrapping-hinkley-for-renewable-alternatives-will-save-tens-of-billions

http://about.bnef.com/landing-pages/five-reasons-build-hinkley/

attributes.action: Gastrointestinal Motility disorders in patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background:
There is a huge gap in healthcare for conditions such as gastropareses, pseudo obstruction, dysmotility , intestinal failure etc
These conditions result in severe pain, bloating, vomiting, malnutrition and inability to eat to name a few.
This severly impacts lives, & quality of life is very low.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is no cure there is lack of understanding by healthcare providers to the point we either have to tell them what to do ourselves or get sent home with little to no treatment plan, we get passed from doctor to doctor who each give up on us, many dont even get to the stage of diagnosis. 
I am asking for a nation wide campaign to educate GPS , Consultants, Nurses and health workers in general on the importance of management and understanding of these conditions. 
We should not be left to suffer with no one to listen, help or control the symptoms.

attributes.action: Abolish the "Civil" football ban
attributes.background: How can you ban lads from going to football and take away their passports when they haven't even commited any crime
